@graph.caption: square image of a vegan chocolate chip muffin with more in background

@graph.name: Vegan Chocolate Chip Muffins - Nora Cooks
@graph.description: Moist, soft, and chocolatey Vegan Chocolate Chip Muffins are easy to make in 1 bowl using pantry-staple ingredients.

@graph.name: Vegan Chocolate Chip Muffins
@graph.description: It doesn’t get any more classic than this! Vegan Chocolate Chip Muffins are chocolatey, moist, and made with simple ingredients.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a standard muffin pan with non-stick spray or use paper liners and spray them with a little oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a standard muffin pan with non-stick spray or use paper liners and spray them with a little oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the soy milk and apple cider vinegar in a glass measuring cup and set aside to curdle. This is your "buttermilk".
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the soy milk and apple cider vinegar in a glass measuring cup and set aside to curdle. This is your "buttermilk".

recipeInstructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together all the dry ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and cornstarch.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together all the dry ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and cornstarch.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour in the soy milk/vinegar mixture, melted vegan butter and vanilla. Stir with a large spoon to combine, but do not over mix. Some small lumps are fine.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour in the soy milk/vinegar mixture, melted vegan butter and vanilla. Stir with a large spoon to combine, but do not over mix. Some small lumps are fine.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in the chocolate chips, gently. Using a small measuring cup or ice cream scoop, add batter to the liners and fill all the way to the top. Top with a sprinkle of coarse sugar, if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Fold in the chocolate chips, gently. Using a small measuring cup or ice cream scoop, add batter to the liners and fill all the way to the top. Top with a sprinkle of coarse sugar, if desired.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 22-26 minutes, until lightly golden brown on top and a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Do not over bake, or they will be dry and hard. Let cool 5 minutes in the pan, then move to a cooling rack. Eat and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 22-26 minutes, until lightly golden brown on top and a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Do not over bake, or they will be dry and hard. Let cool 5 minutes in the pan, then move to a cooling rack. Eat and enjoy!

recipeInstructions.text: Store leftover muffins in an airtight container at room temperature for about 3 days. You can also freeze them by wrapping them in plastic wrap and placing them in a large freezer bag.
recipeInstructions.name: Store leftover muffins in an airtight container at room temperature for about 3 days. You can also freeze them by wrapping them in plastic wrap and placing them in a large freezer bag.

@graph.keywords: dairy free chocolate chip muffins, vegan chocolate chip muffins
